summary.span: 定义 ASP.NET 为使用自定义成员资格提供程序提供成员资格服务而实现的协定。

span.span: Defines the contract that ASP.NET implements to provide membership services using custom membership providers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET 成员资格被为了让你能够轻松使用大量不同的成员资格提供程序的 ASP.NET 应用程序。ASP.NET membership is designed to enable you to easily use a number of different membership providers for your ASP.NET applications. 可以使用随.NET Framework 提供成员资格提供程序也可以实现自己的提供程序。You can use the supplied membership providers that are included with the .NET Framework, or you can implement your own provider. > [!NOTE] > 如果您不熟悉 ASP.NET 成员资格功能，请参阅[成员资格简介](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79184d17-f4c7-4c9f-a073-cec4f5543980(v=vs.100))然后再继续。If you are not familiar with the membership features of ASP.NET, see [Introduction to Membership](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79184d17-f4c7-4c9f-a073-cec4f5543980(v=vs.100)) before continuing. 与成员资格相关的其他主题的列表，请参阅[使用成员资格管理用户](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/824c3a24-f0af-427c-a652-0d2d1e9397cd)。For a list of other topics related to membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/824c3a24-f0af-427c-a652-0d2d1e9397cd). 在实现自定义成员资格提供程序时，需要继承抽象类。When implementing a custom membership provider, you are required to inherit the abstract class. 有两个用于创建自定义成员资格提供程序的主要原因。There are two primary reasons for creating a custom membership provider. - 您必须将成员资格信息存储在.NET Framework 中，如 FoxPro 数据库、 Oracle 数据库或其他数据源中包含的成员资格提供程序不支持的数据源中。You need to store membership information in a data source that is not supported by the membership providers included with the .NET Framework, such as a FoxPro database, an Oracle database, or other data source. - 需要管理使用不同于使用.NET Framework 附带的提供程序的数据库架构的数据库架构的成员身份信息。You need to manage membership information using a database schema that is different from the database schema used by the providers that ship with the .NET Framework. 此常见示例是公司或网站上的 SQL Server 数据库中已存在的成员身份数据。A common example of this would be membership data that already exists in a SQL Server database for a company or Web site. 抽象类继承自抽象类。The abstract class inherits from the abstract class. 实现还必须实现所需的成员的。 implementations must also implement the required members of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性值存储在具有相关的用户信息，以便将用户与特定应用程序相关联的数据源。The property value is stored in the data source with related user information to associate a user with a particular application. 此属性为读/写，且默认为未显式指定的属性值。This property is read/write and defaults to the property value if not specified explicitly. 成员资格提供程序存储单独为每个应用程序的用户信息，因为多个 ASP.NET 应用程序可以使用相同的数据源，而不会遇到冲突，如果创建了重复的用户名。Because membership providers store user information uniquely for each application, multiple ASP.NET applications can use the same data source without running into a conflict if duplicate user names are created. 或者，多个 ASP.NET 应用程序可以使用相同的用户数据源，通过指定相同。Alternatively, multiple ASP.NET applications can use the same user data source by specifying the same . 在成员资格提供程序实现中，你将需要确保数据架构，包括和数据源查询和更新还包含。In your membership provider implementation, you will need to ensure that your data schema includes the and that data source queries and updates also include the . ## Examples 有关的示例实现中，请参阅[实现配置文件提供程序](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98)。For an example of a implementation, see [Implementing a Profile Provider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将新用户、 密码和电子邮件地址作为输入，并将该应用程序的新用户插入到数据源。Takes, as input, the name of a new user, a password, and an email address and inserts a new user for the application into the data source. 方法将返回填充新创建的用户的信息的对象。The method returns a object populated with the information for the newly created user. 方法还定义了`out`参数 (在 Visual Basic 中，你可以使用`ByRef`)，它返回值，该值指示用户已成功创建，或该用户创建失败原因。The method also defines an `out` parameter (in Visual Basic, you can use `ByRef`) that returns a value that indicates that the user was successfully created, or a reason that user creation failed. 方法将引发事件，如果事件处理程序已指定，并继续或取消创建用户操作基于事件的结果。The method raises the event, if a event handler has been specified, and continues or cancels the create-user action based on the results of the event. 可以使用要执行指定的虚拟方法事件处理程序。You can use the virtual method to execute the specified event handler. ## Examples 有关的示例实现中，请参阅[实现配置文件提供程序](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98)。For an example of a implementation, see [Implementing a Profile Provider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性的工作原理与结合可防止不需要猜测密码或通过成员资格用户的密码提示问题答案的源来反复尝试。The property works in conjunction with the property to guard against an unwanted source guessing the password or password answer of a membership user through repeated attempts. 如果无效密码或密码提示问题答案的成员资格用户的数目大于或等于属性值在指定的分钟数内，然后通过设置锁定成员资格用户属性设置为`true`直到通过调用解除锁定用户方法。If the number of invalid passwords or password questions supplied for a membership user is greater than or equal to the property value within the number of minutes identified by the , then the membership user is locked out by setting the property to `true` until the user is unlocked by a call to the method. 如果之前提供有效密码或密码提示问题答案达到值时，会跟踪无效尝试的次数的计数器重置为零。If a valid password or password answer is supplied before the value is reached, the counter that tracks the number of invalid attempts is reset to zero. 无效的密码和密码提示问题答案尝试会互相独立地累积。Invalid password and password-answer attempts accumulate independently of one another. 例如，如果属性设置为 5，和三次无效密码尝试，跟两次无效密码提示问题答案尝试，之内须进行两次无效密码尝试（或三次无效密码提示问题答案尝试）成员资格用户才会被锁定。For example, if the property is set to 5, and three invalid password attempts are made followed by two invalid password-answer attempts, two more invalid password attempts (or three more invalid password-answer attempts) must be made within the for the membership user to be locked out. 如果属性设置为`false`，不跟踪无效密码提示问题答案尝试次数。If the property is set to `false`, invalid password-answer attempts are not tracked. 在中跟踪无效密码和密码提示问题答案尝试， ， ， ，和方法。Invalid password and password-answer attempts are tracked in the , , , , and methods. ## Examples 有关的示例实现中，请参阅[实现配置文件提供程序](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98)。For an example of a implementation, see [Implementing a Profile Provider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98).

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示成员资格数据存储中存储密码的格式。

span.span: Gets a value indicating the format for storing passwords in the membership data store.

value.span: 值之一，它指示数据存储中存储密码的格式。

span.span: One of the values indicating the format for storing passwords in the data store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性指示密码存储中的格式。The property indicates the format that passwords are stored in. 使用`Hashed`仅`Clear`和`Encrypted`是不安全的。Use `Hashed` only, `Clear` and `Encrypted` are not secure. `Hashed` 使用单向哈希算法和随机生成的 salt 值存储在数据库中时，将会经过密码哈希。`Hashed` passwords are hashed using a one-way hash algorithm and a randomly generated salt value when stored in the database. 密码验证时，它是哈希处理用于验证数据库中的 salt 值。When a password is validated, it is hashed with the salt value in the database for verification. 无法检索哈希的密码。Hashed passwords cannot be retrieved. `Encrypted` 密码不被视为安全，受到破坏，可以显示出您的数据库的内容也可以公开加密密钥。`Encrypted` passwords are not considered safe, as a breach that reveals your database contents can also expose the encryption key. 这意味着无法解密已加密的密码，并将其公开。This means your encrypted passwords could be decrypted and exposed. 可以使用并的虚拟方法类来加密和解密密码值，也可以提供自己的加密代码。You can use the and virtual methods of the class to encrypt and decrypt password values, or you can supply your own encryption code. 如果您使用并的虚拟方法类，`Encrypted`中提供的密钥信息的使用密码进行加密[machineKey 元素 （ASP.NET 设置架构）](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4b5699a9-bc21-4c4a-85f1-8b3b8ebd2d46)在配置中的元素。If you use the and virtual methods of the class, `Encrypted` passwords are encrypted using the key information supplied in the [machineKey Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4b5699a9-bc21-4c4a-85f1-8b3b8ebd2d46) element in your configuration. ## Examples 有关的示例实现中，请参阅[实现配置文件提供程序](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98)。For an example of a implementation, see [Implementing a Profile Provider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性获取用于评估密码复杂性的正则表达式对象。The property gets the regular expression used to evaluate password complexity for the object. 属性设置在应用程序配置中使用`passwordStrengthRegularExpression`的属性[元素 （ASP.NET 设置架构） 的成员身份](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b9c1ee8f-33ca-4361-8666-b42a0fe86049)配置元素。The property is set in the application configuration using the `passwordStrengthRegularExpression` attribute of the [membership Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b9c1ee8f-33ca-4361-8666-b42a0fe86049) configuration element. ## Examples 下面的示例演示[元素 （ASP.NET 设置架构） 的成员身份](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b9c1ee8f-33ca-4361-8666-b42a0fe86049)中的配置元素`system.web`部分中的应用程序的 Web.config 文件。The following example shows the [membership Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b9c1ee8f-33ca-4361-8666-b42a0fe86049) configuration element in the `system.web` section of the application's Web.config file. 它指定应用程序使用的实例类提供成员资格服务和集`passwordStrengthRegularExpression`属性验证的密码符合以下条件的正则表达式：It specifies that the application use an instance of the class to provide membership services, and sets the `passwordStrengthRegularExpression` attribute to a regular expression that validates that the password meets the following criteria: - 大于七个字符。Is greater than seven characters. - 包含至少一个数字。Contains at least one digit. - 包含至少一个特殊的 （非字母数字） 字符。Contains at least one special (non-alphanumeric) character. 如果密码不满足这些条件，成员资格提供程序不接受此密码。If the password does not meet these criteria, the password is not accepted by the membership provider. ``` ```

member this.ValidatingPassword : System.Web.Security.MembershipValidatePasswordEventHandler

summary.span: 在创建了用户、更改了密码或重置了密码时发生。

span.span: Occurs when a user is created, a password is changed, or a password is reset.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 期间引发事件， ，和方法。The event is raised during the , , and methods. 事件发生之前请求的操作，并使用户能够继续或取消请求的操作。The event occurs before the action requested and enables the user to continue or cancel the requested action. 如果操作被取消，用户可以指定将引发异常。If the action is canceled, the user can specify an exception to be thrown. 用户使用事件处理程序指定的处理程序事件。Users use a event handler to specify a handler for the event. 提供程序实施者可以使用虚方法引发事件。Provider implementers can use the virtual method to raise the event. ## Examples 有关的示例实现中，请参阅[实现配置文件提供程序](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98)。For an example of a implementation, see [Implementing a Profile Provider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98).
